snippet: Richard G. Lugar, one of the Senate’s longest-serving members, lost a hard-fought Republican primary to Richard E. Mourdock, the Indiana state treasurer.
abstract: Indiana's six-term Sen Richard G Lugar, one of the Senate's longest-serving members, loses a hard-fought Republican primary to Richard E Mourdock, the state treasurer; Mourdock's campaign was fueled by Tea Party groups and national conservative organizations that deemed collegial moderate Lugar too willing to compromise.

byline.contributor: Carl Hulse and Jennifer Steinhauer contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Richard G. Lugar, one of the Senate’s longest-serving members, lost a hard-fought Republican primary to Richard E. Mourdock, the Indiana state treasurer.

headline.main: Lugar Loses Primary Challenge in Indiana
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Voters Topple Lugar After 6 Terms
